definitions: Refers to a system or an alphabetical list of names, subjects, etc., with references to the places where they occur, typically found at the end of a book.
Records (names, subjects, etc.) in an index.
Adjusts (wages, pensions, or prices) according to an index of prices or costs.
examples: The librarian indexes new arrivals daily.
The software indexes all documents for quick retrieval.
The government indexes pensions to inflation.
